wikipedia_page.main: Edward Elliott  (c. 1800–1867) was born in Northumberland. He was a writer of popular humorous songs, and, in turn, an alcoholic, a reformed alcoholic, and an ardent temperance worker. His most famous song is  "Whitley Camp".

link_mentions.page: Allan's Illustrated Edition of Tyneside Songs and Readings

response: * Edward Elliott (songwriter) (1800–1867), English writer of popular humorous songs
